001package nbody;
002
003import edu.princeton.cs.In;
004import edu.princeton.cs.StdDraw;
005import java.awt.Color;
006import java.awt.List;
007import java.util.ArrayList;
008import java.util.concurrent.ThreadLocalRandom;
009import java.util.Random;
010
011/**
012 * ****************************************************************************
013 * Compilation: javac Universe.java Execution: java Universe dt input.txt
014 * Dependencies: Body.java Vector.java StdIn.java StdDraw.java Datafiles:
015 * http://www.cs.princeton.edu/introcs/34nbody/2body.txt
016 * http://www.cs.princeton.edu/introcs/34nbody/3body.txt
017 * http://www.cs.princeton.edu/introcs/34nbody/4body.txt
018 * http://www.cs.princeton.edu/introcs/34nbody/2bodyTiny.txt
019 *
020 * This data-driven program simulates motion in the universe defined by the
021 * standard input stream, increasing time at the rate on the command line.
022 *
023 * % java Universe 25000 4body.txt
024 *
025 *
026 *****************************************************************************
027 */
028public class Universe {
029
030    private final double radius;     // radius of universe
031    private final int N;             // number of bodies
032    private final Body[] orbs;       // array of N bodies
033    private final int S;             // number of stars
034    private final Star[] stars;      // array of stars
035
036    // read universe from file
037    public Universe(String fileName) {
038
039        // the authors' version reads from standard input
040        // our version reads from a file
041        In inputStream = new In(fileName);
042
043        // number of bodies
044        N = inputStream.readInt();
045
046        // number of stars
047        S = 600;
048
049        // the set scale for drawing on screen
050        StdDraw.setCanvasSize(900, 900);
051
052        radius = inputStream.readDouble();
053        StdDraw.setXscale(-radius, +radius);
054        StdDraw.setYscale(-radius, +radius);
055
056        // read in the N bodies
057        orbs = new Body[N];
058        for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
059            double rx = inputStream.readDouble();
060            double ry = inputStream.readDouble();
061            double vx = inputStream.readDouble();
062            double vy = inputStream.readDouble();
063            double mass = inputStream.readDouble();
064            double[] position = {rx, ry};
065            double[] velocity = {vx, vy};
066            Vector r = new Vector(position);
067            Vector v = new Vector(velocity);
068            double size = mass * .0000000000000000000000000000000001;
069            orbs[i] = new Body(r, v, mass);
070        } // for
071
072        // do some stars
073        stars = new Star[S];
074        for (int i = 0; i < S; i++) {
075            double sX;
076            double sY;
077
078            //sX = (double) (r.nextInt((int) radius));
079            //sY = (double) (r.nextInt((int) radius));
080            sX = ThreadLocalRandom.current().nextDouble(-radius, +radius);
081            sY = ThreadLocalRandom.current().nextDouble(-radius, +radius);
082
083            stars[i] = new Star(sX, sY);
084        }
085    } // Universe()
086
087    // increment time by dt units, assume forces are constant in given interval
088    public void increaseTime(double dt) {
089
090        // initialize the forces to zero
091        Vector[] f = new Vector[N];
092        for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
093            f[i] = new Vector(new double[2]);
094        } // for
095
096        // compute the forces
097        for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
098            for (int j = 0; j < N; j++) {
099                if (i != j) {
100                    f[i] = f[i].plus(orbs[i].forceFrom(orbs[j]));
101                } // if
102            } // for
103        } // for
104
105        // move the bodies
106        for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
107            orbs[i].move(f[i], dt);
108        } // for
109    } // increaseTime( double )
110
111    // draw the N bodies
112    public void draw() {
113        for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
114            orbs[i].draw();
115        } // for
116    } // draw()
117
118    // draw stars
119    public void burn() {
120        for (int i = 0; i < S; i++) {
121            stars[i].shine();
122            stars[i].draw();
123        }
124    }
125
126    // client to simulate a universe
127    public static void main(String[] args) {
128        Universe newton = new Universe(args[1]);
129        double dt = Double.parseDouble(args[0]);
130
131        while (true) {
132            StdDraw.clear(Color.BLACK);
133            newton.burn();
134            newton.increaseTime(dt);
135            StdDraw.setPenColor(Color.WHITE);
136            newton.draw();
137            StdDraw.show(10);
138            //StdDraw.textLeft(0, 0, "HELLO");
139        } // while
140    } // main( String [] )
141} // Universe
